alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Essex; Orange (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 12:08AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Orange, southeastern Caledonia and southwestern Essex Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1208 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ryegate, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... St. Johnsbury, Lyndon, Waterford, Lyndonville Village, Ryegate, Gilman, Kirby, Barnet, Concord, Ricker State Park, Danville, Lower Waterford, Wells River Village, Peacham, Groton Village, Groton, Lunenburg, Victory, Burke, and Sutton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 91 between mile markers 111 and 118, and between mile markers 120 and 142. Interstate 93 between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
